comments:
I20060315-1200

I was debugging Eclipse and suspended on a breakpoint. I selected one of the lower-level stackframes and started exploring an ElementChangedEvent in the variables view (columns mode). I had expanded roughly 8 levels of the tree in the Variables view, when the view suddenly became blank. The Debug view also didn't show the stacktrace any more, but just a blank entry.

The Resume button was not active for the blank thread. I selected the parent of the thread nodes and pressed Resume. This didn't do anythin, except for throwing this exception:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed

I left my machine running rests overnight, and when I came back, the tests hung in a breakpoint (I debugged tests and forgot to disable breakpoints...).

I found about 190 of these exceptions in my log (in a timespan of 10 minutes).

I think the two problems are not related. I got the threads problem (bug #135708)
without the "widget disposed" exception.
On a separate run I got lots of "widget disposed" exceptions too....
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 127232 ***
